definition: to fill a tooth (cavity)/to have a tooth filled/a dental filling
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: The dentist gave my tooth a blast to dry the filling.
sentences.chinese: 牙医朝我的牙吹风使补牙材料干结。

sentences.english: How much do you charge for fillings?
The buildup could lead to costly dental repairs.
sentences.chinese: 这样做会导致你花很花钱去补牙。

sentences.english: Why don't you give the inlays to the mechanic?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不补牙的工作交给技工呢？

sentences.english: The last time I was at the dentist, he told me that I needed to get a filling.
sentences.chinese: 我上次去看牙医，他告诉我需要去补牙。

sentences.english: He used a lamp similar to those used by dentists to cure fillings.
sentences.chinese: 他应用了一种类似牙医用来补牙的灯来提供紫外线。

sentences.english: A dentist filling a cavity does not need to find out about a family history of Huntington's disease.
sentences.chinese: 牙医在补牙时也不用管病人有杭丁顿氏症家族史。

sentences.english: You need patience when you are having your teeth filled.
sentences.chinese: 在补牙的时候你需要有耐心。

sentences.english: If a beaver needed dental work, where would it go?
sentences.chinese: 如果一只海狸需要补牙，那么它应该去找谁呢？

definition: to have a false tooth set in/denture
caries/rotten tooth (colloquial)/see also 齲齒|龋齿[qu3 chi3]
